reviewText: The course is stated as free certified but still is asking for money to upgrade . The worst experience with Cousera.
I cannot understand what they are saying.  The accents were too thick, I didn't make it through the first 2 videos of the free trial
Very disappointed to have been charged for an additional month long after having completed the course. Don't get robbed, cancel subscription manually after completing the course

Very difficult to understand presenters even with subtitles. The slides available for download don't have copy so you have to go back and download the transcripts that are very small.  No examples of creative briefs for ones to use as reference or learn to write.
too much useless words and unnecessary animation  effect
It was a great course. I enjoy doing it.
Interesting topics and good overview. Nevertheless I'd have wished to see more visual aid in the presentations. Sometimes the spanish speaking guests were hardly understandable.

This course focuses on definitions and basic recall of phrases rather than on true comprehension or application: for example, the quizzes exclusively test one's note-taking ability (tip: whenever the professor lists a series of things, it will be quiz question). The course would be better if they had students evaluate cases or determine better approaches to IMC -- or if they spent time showing or allowing students to examine *how* something is done rather than just what things are named.
tutor is Russian i guess her accent is not quite understandable
Not quite what I was expecting
I liked the course. However, I found it a bit basic. For a beginner he is great. For someone with  knowledge in the field, it leaves somthing to be desired.
good
needs a practice case
Found it a little too easy but that might be based on previous experience.
Me gusto, aunque siento que es un poco largo para los conceptos que nos dan.Si manejas redes, no es para vos, está dedicado más a publicidades y a gente que trabaje en agencias de publicidades

The accent of the female professor was somehow hard to understand. There is a lot of reading sources that take more time to finish that the estimated time on the course and I think the interviews almost make no good to me as an audience.
Need to have detailed strategy planning.

I appreciated the course content, with a lot of new and important concepts. The format of the videos and the expert interviews were really helpful. I did struggle with the accents a lot, and the subtitles were not always accurate. Furthermore, I would have liked to learn more on how these concepts can be used in B2B.
Too theoretical. More practical application examples would be helpful.
Not a very pleasant experience on listening to the professor's english. She pauses and her english isn't very great.
The lecture is good but it might be perfect with well-organized course material.

If I could give a half star in addition to the 2 given, I would.  This was a great course. However it was hard to understand the professors and some of the language that was then in turn translated wasn't quite clear when some accronyms and definitions were a few words off.  The lessons taught were great and the knowledge I acquired was exactly what I was looking for, it was just the accents that were hard to decifer. Thank you for this course. I will most likely still take more from IE Business School, but at least will be prepared for printing out the text of the videos instead of stressing over trying to figure out what was said.
Great foundation course for anyone starting with Marketing. More on the side of Marketing in big corp and big brand than SMEs and startups.
El curso me ha gustado mucho, sin  embargo una gran parte de las entrevistas con expertos me han resultado de poca utilidad. Muy buena la del ejecutivo de Sanitas, por ejemplo.

The course was engaging with a good mix of readings, video lectures and industry expert modules. It helped me refresh my IMC concepts and amp up my conceptual readiness while working on creating communication campaigns at work.
Precise. Concise.
Great course to learn the about Integrated Marketing Communications.
e​njoyed the learning experience..........

so good i reaaly like it.
Mostly advertising focused, a good intro but deeper coverage of the wider IMC mix would be better.

It's a great course, a clear system for introducing IMC. It would be perfect if there were more practical methods
Interesting course

Really great overview of Integrated Marketing Communications! However, the English translation is very hard to follow and is sometimes incorrect which makes it hard to understand certain parts of the course.

I would assume more videos in detail to make a better understanding in marketing communication tools. Reading sections can be found by searching by the learner so that is not the part that makes the difference. Nevertheless, I learned and enjoyed a lot during the course. The most fun part is the interviews with the individuals who play key roles in this area. Thank you!
This course help me a lot thank you coursera thank you Eda and thank you IE
Very helpful
Easy To Understand and gives you the knowledge to promote your products
need some assignment to include at the end of each week.

Perhaps integrate more multiple choice questions within the instructional videos. There were some already, which I of course noticed, however — I think that driving your customer's engagement within this course will increase retention and completion rates. Deploying more multiple choice questions may help you achieve that. Also, perhaps some different styles of "knowledge testing" aside from multiple choice would make the course feel more value-added.
Well done by Professor and it was amazing. I have learned a lot.
Fantastic Course, language tends to be more Spanish oriented for obvious reasons, but main instructor's way of explaining and English is good. 4/5!
Got an excellent understanding about marketing communication basics. But Expected More on how to integrate Public Relations, Digital Marketing in Marketing Communication.
Sometimes data are a bit outdated but generally, it answers the challenges of 2020. Readings are useful but it could be useful to get a bit more outline of the recommended articles.
Very very helpfu.

Great course! Liked how Professor Edna taught with examples and covered every topic smartly instead of trying to teach through lengthy marketing definitions. Last module could have been elaborated in terms of social media marketing.
A bit outdated but very useful!

Overall the course was interesting and informative. Good for getting the first introduction to advertising. There were some moments that I wanted to point out for the members of the staff. As the speakers are not English natives, sometimes it was very hard to understand them, hence many times I had to refer to  the transcripts, but some of them were very badly transcribed with many grammar mistakes to the point of distorting the meaning of the sentences.  Nonetheless, overall it was a good course. Thank you.

Actually there is no provision to give 4.7 Therefore I had to click 4!Very Good Construction and Delivery of the CourseIn each module more live examples of Ads, materials  downloadble will further enhanceAlso will appreciate if, in future if any enhancement, new modules are brought in, you can add it in My Account with Coursera
A lot less digital than expected
Very enlightening

Very informative with real life examples to back the theoretical content. Clear and concise lectures from a great professor. 4 stars just because I would have liked more visual representation of the content, and downloadable slides to make it easier to remember the content.
Very interesting and educating! I love the practical examples shown in the videos, makes things easier to understand. Kudos!
Very informative and direct to the point. I have learned a lot!
Great course, I learn many examples and informations
Great course, nice options, diverse examples.

Good mix of concepts and interviews. Taken off one star only because several of the optional readings were books excerpts or papers not provided by IE business school as part of the course i.e. paid for 3rd party content. Otherwise good addition to the specialization.

It is really helpful .. I glad to have the opportunity to learn this course. All aspect of marketing is covered within one course so could say that it is complete within itself. Some points need to be elaborated more but still, I am satisfied with the way they taught.
Good
Good fundamental knowledge of communication and its elements and how it relates to each other - with the key element of integration.

My informative and interesting course. Specially the marketing mix model along with messaging techniques. The elements are very interesting from a theory point of view. If you learn these elements, then it will become easy for you execute marketing communication. Also, few advertisement examples are too good to understand the concept. These ads will stay in your mind and will help you craft your ads, communications effectively. in B2C marketing and advertisement - this course will be an eye-opener for you. You must attend it to learn the concepts. I have taken this course and when I completed - I was quite equipped with concepts of Marketing Communication.
More insights on the industry with CEO's and digital marketing executives would be helpful
Very helpful in learning basic concepts and testing your knowledge with the assignments is super helpful. I enjoyed the course very much.

I think it's an amazing course in terms of information, because it's really complete and it gives you all the bases to understand the communication process in the Marketing Plan. It's a teorical course most of the time, so I 'd only suggest more examples in every topic to make it more dynamic, I mean, there could be more videos or images of ads, but just that. I learned a lot in this course and I definitely recommend it. Thanks a lot!
Not bad-Writing assignments would help a great deal!
Definitely covers fundamentals but does not feel very advanced or cutting edge. Perhaps content could be updated to 2011-2017 material. This mostly seems 1990-2000.

The course was well structured. Theory, examples, case studies and interviews. It is quite excellent, if you are a beginner and trying to understand what exactly is Integrated Marketing Communication is all about. However, the course is a very basic introductory course, and you will need to explore more to get sufficient knowledge to practice the same.The frameworks provided in this course, however, were quite useful in helping me develop my marketing campaigns for my startup. The same got good response.

I liked the course but i was expecting more information on the digital module, since now digital is driving our lives and also the marketing campaigns. It´s not another tool, it should be exactly as the speaker from Sanitas said, an UMBRELLA that guides all the other communications.

The course work was clear and well organized. Sometimes I did not understand the Edna, the teacher which is fine however sometimes the corresponding transcript indicated that what I heard was correct and that the words she said did not make sense grammatically. Nothing to get hung up on as I received the idea, which is the point.

I never found myself getting bored with her lectures and, in fact, looked forward to watching them as I knew I was going to enjoy each module. I especially enjoyed the interviews with various professionals in the marketing industry as I felt I learned a great deal from their added observations and expertise.  For fellow English speakers, I highly recommend watching this course with subtitles on to get the most out of it.
